summary: CLINTON claimed in the last sentence that Sanders "never came to campaign for Vincent Sheheen when he was running for governor."
CLINTON claimed in this line that neither Sanders nor O'Malley came to campaign for Vincent Sheheen when he was running for governor.

CLAIM: Clinton claims that O'Malley's personal experience with gun violence does not justify his claim of being the only candidate who brought people together to pass comprehensive gun safety legislation.

This claim was made by Clinton during the Democratic debate in Charleston, South Carolina on January 17th, 2016.

CLINTON claims during the Democratic debate in Charleston, South Carolina on January 17th, 2016 that 90 people a day die from gun violence in the country, which amounts to 33,000 people a year. She also mentions a specific example of nine people being murdered nearby. CLINTON expresses her satisfaction with Senator Sanders reversing his position on immunity and hopes he will support legislation introduced by members of Congress. She argues that the gun industry should not be given a total pass and that this needs to be reversed.
During a Democratic debate in Charleston, South Carolina on January 17th, 2016, Sanders claimed that the current economic system is rigged in favor of the wealthy and powerful.
